sentences.en: Both GM and Ford believe they need classier brand names to sell upmarket cars.
sentences.cn: 通用汽车公司和福特公司都认为它们需要用更有气派的品牌名称销售高档车。

sentences.en: Even Ford, who seldom smiled, laughed out loud a few times.
sentences.cn: 即使是很少笑的福特，有几次也笑出声来。

sentences.en: Ford allowed the name and trademark to lapse during the Eighties.
sentences.cn: 福特在20世纪80年代废止了该名称和商标。

sentences.en: Ford had the bright idea of paying workers enough to buy cars.
sentences.cn: 福特公司想出了一绝妙的主意：付给工人足够的薪水去购买汽车。

sentences.en: Ford is definitely not a man to let a little success go to his head.
sentences.cn: 福特绝对不是那种会被一点点成功冲昏头脑的人。

sentences.en: Ford was a respecter of proprieties and liked to see things done properly.
sentences.cn: 福特非常重视礼仪，喜欢把事情办得妥帖得体。

sentences.en: Ford's letters to her are fond and confiding.
sentences.cn: 福特写给她的信饱含深情，向她吐露了心声。

sentences.en: He will now fight Kevin Ford on the five-bout card.
sentences.cn: 他将在五局制比赛中迎战凯文·福特。

sentences.en: Henry Ford was an automobile baron.
sentences.cn: 亨利·福特是一位汽车业巨头.

sentences.en: In many writers modesty is a pose, but in Ford it seems to have been genuine.
sentences.cn: 很多作家都是故作谦虚，但福特却似乎表里如一。

sentences.en: My parents own a Ford sedan.
sentences.cn: 我父母有一辆“福特”牌轿车.

sentences.en: Several manufacturers are also nibbling away at Ford's traditional customer base.
sentences.cn: 几家制造商也在蚕食福特公司的传统客户群。

sentences.en: The Ford Foundation allocated millions of dollars for cancer research.
sentences.cn: 福特基金会拨款数百万美元用于癌症研究.

sentences.en: They were guarding the bridge, so we forded the river.
sentences.cn: 他们当时守着那座桥，我们就涉水过了那条河。

sentences.en: They're negotiating a tie-up with Ford.
sentences.cn: 他们正在与福特公司洽谈合作事宜。

sentences.en: Working with Ford closely, I fell in love with the cinema.
sentences.cn: 与福特的密切合作开始令我爱上了电影。

phrases.tran_cn: 福特福克斯（美国汽车公司）
福特基金会（私人慈善机构）
福特汽车（美国汽车公司）
n. 杰拉尔德·福特（美国第38任总统）
哈里森·福特（美国著名影星）
n. 亨利·福特（人名，福特公司创始人）

trans.tran_cn: 浅滩，可涉水而过的地方，福特（人名），福特汽车
trans.tran_en: a place where a river is not deep, so that you can walk or drive across it
If you ford a river or stream, you cross it without using a boat, usually at a shallow point
